title: BougeRV’s telescopic lantern is ridiculously versatile
snippets: Itâ€™s sold as an outdoor camplight, but BougeRVâ€™s very bright LED lantern is really a multifunctional work lamp for any place that needs an extra dose of lighting. Itâ€™s rechargeable and compact enough to serve as a long-lasting flashlight with three swiveling LED panels that can direct 3000 lumens onto your table, campsite, workspace, or engine block […]
summary: BougeRV's LED lantern, marketed for outdoor use, also functions as a versatile work lamp with three adjustable LED panels, emitting up to 3000 lumens. It is rechargeable and compact, suitable for various settings needing additional light.

title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: A court took action on Friday to keep the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) from shutting down a consumer watchdog agency while its court case plays out. Judge Amy Berman Jackson granted a preliminary injunction to save the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) from being further gutted while she decides whether […]
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft is no longer playing around when it comes to requiring every Windows 11 device be set up with an internet-connected account. In its latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, the company says it will take out a well-known bypass script that let end users skip the requirement of connecting to the internet and logging in […]
summary: Microsoft has announced that in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, it will remove a script that previously allowed users to bypass the requirement of having an internet-connected account to set up Windows 11 devices.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon’s Big Spring Sale is happening now through Monday, March 31st, with several dozen good-to-great deals available that don’t require an Amazon Prime membership. Our main roundup has you covered with more than 100 deals on Verge-favorite gear with quite a high price ceiling. But, for this post, we wanted to provide some low-cost alternatives […]
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway until Monday, March 31st, offering numerous deals accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. The sale features over 100 deals on popular gear, alongside a selection of budget-friendly options.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: A few years after buying Twitter for $44 billion, Elon Musk announced that his AI business xAI has acquired the social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter. In a tweet, he described it as an all-stock transaction, valuing xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, including $12 billion in debt it had […]
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X, previously known as Twitter, in an all-stock deal. Musk, who bought Twitter a few years ago for $44 billion, announced the acquisition, valuing xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion in debt.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft is starting to test Quick Machine Recovery, a feature designed to prevent incidents like last year’s Crowdstrike catastrophe. It’s rolling out in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) and allows IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices even if they won’t boot. Microsoft first announced Quick Machine Recovery last year as part […]
summary: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), a feature aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that are unable to boot. This development comes as a response to prevent incidents similar to the previous year's Crowdstrike catastrophe.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: After Google completed its acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021, the company integrated Fitbit’s services with its own and required users to migrate existing Fitbit accounts to a Google account by 2025. But in an email sent to Fitbit users today, Google now says that deadline has been extended until next year.  “As we have […]
summary: Google, which acquired Fitbit in early 2021, initially set a deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to Google by 2025. However, the company has now extended this deadline to next year, as communicated in an email to Fitbit users.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time
snippets: The company that has pushed to open up the deep sea for mining is cozying up to the Trump administration after years of hitting roadblocks in international negotiations.  The island nation of Nauru initially sponsored The Metals Company (TMC) and its deep-sea mining effort. In 2021, that triggered a race to develop regulations before TMC […]
summary: The Metals Company (TMC), aiming to initiate deep-sea mining, has sought closer ties with the Trump administration following challenges in international talks. Initially sponsored by Nauru, TMC's efforts in 2021 accelerated efforts to create regulations for deep-sea mining.

title: Amazon’s big spring sale continues, and we found the 101 best deals

summary: Amazon has launched its Big Spring Sale, coinciding with the start of the warmer months. The sale, which includes discounts on gardening supplies and bedding, is currently underway and will continue until Monday, March 31, 2025.

summary: Four Afghan girls, aged 7, named Yasemin, Zakia, Shukriya, and Uzra, fled Afghanistan. Due to a Trump-era order and policies in Pakistan, they face the risk of being sent back to Afghanistan.

title: Myanmar-Thailand earthquake death toll passes 1,000
snippets: Myanmar's military rulers say at least 1,002 people killed following earthquake that also killed 10 people in Thailand.
summary: Myanmar's military authorities reported that an earthquake resulted in the deaths of at least 1,002 individuals within the country. Additionally, the same earthquake led to 10 fatalities in neighboring Thailand.

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'
snippets: Researchers show that a cocktail of growth factors reversed would-be lethal cell damage in mice with anthrax, suggesting that this approach could be adapted for use in patients.
summary: Researchers have developed a growth factor cocktail that successfully reversed critical cell damage in mice infected with anthrax. This breakthrough suggests the potential for adapting this treatment for use in human patients.

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Leveraging the power of AI and machine learning technologies, researchers developed a more effective model for predicting how patients with muscle-invasive bladder cancer will respond to chemotherapy. The model harnesses whole-slide tumor imaging data and gene expression analyses in a way that outperforms previous models using a single data type.
summary: Researchers have created an AI and machine learning-based model that improves predictions of chemotherapy responses in muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients. This model uniquely combines whole-slide tumor imaging data with gene expression analyses, achieving better accuracy than older models relying on just one type of data.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have confirmed a neurobiochemical link between dopamine and cognitive flexibility. PET imaging shows that the brain increases dopamine production when completing cognitively demanding tasks, and that the more dopamine released, the more efficiently the tasks are completed. Armed with this information, physicians may soon be able to develop more precise treatment strategies for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Scientists have discovered a connection between dopamine levels in the brain and cognitive flexibility, finding that increased dopamine production is associated with more efficient task completion. This discovery, made using PET imaging, could help doctors create targeted treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen
snippets: Researchers show that the immune system can recognize and control the latent stage of the parasite Toxoplasma gondii, a finding that can inform the study of latency in other infections of the nervous system.
summary: Researchers have discovered that the immune system can identify and manage the dormant phase of the Toxoplasma gondii parasite. This insight could help in understanding how latency works in other nervous system infections.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: Why do some plants thrive in specific regions but not in others? A study explores the factors shaping plant distributions and how these patterns have changed over millions of years. Analyzing nearly 270,000 seed plant species worldwide, the research highlights the roles of environmental conditions and dispersal barriers in influencing global plant diversity.
summary: A study analyzing nearly 270,000 seed plant species globally has investigated why certain plants flourish in specific regions but not in others. The research identifies environmental conditions and dispersal barriers as key factors influencing plant distributions and diversity across the world, examining changes in these patterns over millions of years.

title: 'Generational' talent Betts keeps No. 1 UCLA rolling
snippets: Lauren Betts had 31 points and 10 rebounds as UCLA rolled past Ole Miss 76-62 to advance to the Elite Eight for the first time since 2018.
summary: Lauren Betts scored 31 points and secured 10 rebounds, leading UCLA to a 76-62 victory over Ole Miss, advancing the team to the Elite Eight for the first time since 2018.

title: Dominant Morrow puts LSU in 3rd straight Elite 8
snippets: With Flau'Jae Johnson struggling, Aneesah Morrow carried the load with 30 points and 19 rebounds as LSU topped NC State 80-73 for its third straight Elite Eight appearance.
summary: Aneesah Morrow scored 30 points and grabbed 19 rebounds, leading LSU to an 80-73 victory over NC State. This win marks LSU's third consecutive Elite Eight appearance in the tournament. Flau'Jae Johnson had a tough game, but Morrow's performance ensured the team's success.

title: Gottlieb defends MSU: JuJu not hurt on dirty play

summary: USC coach Lindsay Gottlieb defended Mississippi State's Chandler Prater from online bullying, stating the ACL injury of JuJu Watkins wasn't caused by a dirty play.

summary: The Dodgers celebrated their World Series victory by unveiling their championship rings, which are made of 14-karat yellow gold and adorned with diamonds and sapphires, following the raising of their championship banner.

summary: UConn coach Geno Auriemma criticized the two-host regional system for the women's NCAA tournament, stating that it has negatively impacted the game. He expressed clear disapproval of the individuals responsible for the decision.

summary: Giannis Antetokounmpo responded to LeBron James' suggestion that he could have scored 250 points in a 1970s game, stating that different basketball eras are incomparable.

summary: Alysa Liu won the women's figure skating world championship, becoming the first American to achieve this title since 2006. She ended Kaori Sakamoto's three-year reign as champion.
